National Tulip Day is recognized by the
Flower Promotion Association.  The Dutch city celebrates on
January 21 to mark a new flower season
of the year and the highlight of the festival is that
everyone can pick tulips for free at the
national city flower day garden established by the
tulip promotion association.  The Netherlands
celebrates the new flower season of the year. The highlight
of the festival is that everyone can pick flowers
for free at the flower garden with about 200,000
flowers showing off. This year, the
free tulip king is arranged in the
square.  The Amsterdam Museum here
will also host a welcome flower bombardment program
and musical performances to
celebrate the special day, which is said to have
originated from a mountain range in Central Asia where
tulips first appeared.  appeared in the Netherlands
in the 16th century thanks to its rare attractive beauty,
tulips quickly became popular in
Western Europe and became the symbolic flower
of the Netherlands. When coming to
Amsterdam, visitors can visit the
flower museum.  TP to learn more about the meaning of
this flower in Dutch culture.
